iati-activity.reporting-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
iati-activity.title: Stimulating an Effective National Response to HIV/AIDS in the Russian Federation
iati-activity.description: Initially the Russian Federation’s HIV epidemic was almost exclusively spread through drug use and the sharing of contaminated needles, but heterosexual transmission is growing. The program supported by this grant aims to address the serious HIV and AIDS epidemic unfolding in the Russian Federation. It represents an integrated approach to improve the knowledge level of youth and the general population and addresses prevention among specific vulnerable groups including injecting drug users, sex workers, street children, men who have sex with men and prisoners. In addition, a treatment, care, health promotion and social support module addresses the needs of people living with HIV. The program also includes an advocacy module to improve the participation and effectiveness of government counterparts in HIV and AIDS policy. The grant term has been extended by two years for the provision of lifesaving prevention services to highly vulnerable groups such as injecting drug users, sex workers and men who have sex with men. The HIV prevention program supported by the grant operates through a consortium of nongovernmental organizations called GLOBUS in ten of the country’s 83 administrative regions.

contact-info.organisation: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

iati-activity.participating-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

conditions.condition: The PR should request from the Minister an official communication that will call on the Regional Health Directors to integrate and make the optimal use of the regional planners

1) The PR should provide guidance and regular supervision to the regional planners
2) Medical regions should provide support to the regional planners to allow them to carry out the supervisions (transport)

1) Procedures developed by the DLSI need to be shared and followed at all levels
2) The PR should rapidly instruct regional and district teams on the reporting requirements of the GF

1) PR to maintain the CCM and LFA informed about the programmatic progress made in the intervals.
2) In phase 2, all indicators should be reported on a semester basis (rehabilitations and blood bags)

1) Strict implementation of the written procedures regarding asset management and tracking mechanism
2) Submission of a comprehensive inventory after one year of programme execution
3) Subscription to insurance contracts for offices and equipment
4) Fire protection measures

1) Review the coordination mechanism between DEM and DLSI for the follow-up of rehabilitations
2) PR should share proposal and ToR for contracting an external architect to monitor the works and ensure the cost is covered in the budget

1) The PR should be careful when defining the terms of the contract with private firms for equipment maintenance
2) The PR should clearly define the role of the DEM in the maintenance scheme
1) The PR should elaborate the contract for procurement with the PNA in full respect of the written procedures (national regulations & manual of procedures).

1) The PR should provide the list of equipment procured and destination
2) Regional planners should follow-up on the installation of equipment

1) The Top management of the DLSI should make sure that the Fiduciary Agent is fully playing its role and is taking part in coordination mechanisms of the GF program
2) Prepare a transition plan after the end of the contract with the Fiduciary Agency at the end of 2012.

iati-activity.reporting-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
iati-activity.title: The Tomsk Oblast Comprehensive Strategy to Contain and Control Tuberculosis
iati-activity.description: The Russian Federation experienced a dramatic increase in TB towards the end of the last century and although incidence rates have begun to level off, they remain high. The program supported by this grant will address the high rates of TB infection, especially multidrug-resistant TB, and rapidly rising rates of HIV infection in the Tomsk Oblast in Russia. Intensive expansion is planned for the treatment of the majority of TB cases already registered, thus decreasing the number of new cases and death rates. Several strategies are being applied to improve patients’ adherence to treatment and to decrease the rate of treatment failures, including the use of incentives for treatment, training of the medical personnel who provide DOTS, as well as treatment of alcoholism in TB patients. In addition, the main TB facilities and bacteriological laboratories are being provided with new infection control equipment, and new methods of rapid TB diagnosis are being introduced.

iati-activity.reporting-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
iati-activity.title: Promoting a Strategic Response to HIV/AIDS Treatment an Care for Vulnerable Populations in the Russian Federation
iati-activity.description: Initially the Russian Federation’s HIV epidemic was almost exclusively spread through drug use and the sharing of contaminated needles, but heterosexual transmission is growing. The program supported by this grant aims to address the serious HIV and AIDS epidemic unfolding in the Russian Federation. The program supported by this grant aims to provide a comprehensive approach to identify people living with HIV in poor and vulnerable populations, refer them to treatment and care based on international standards, and provide them with counseling on adherence and HIV prevention, and with psychosocial and palliative care. The program is primarily implemented in the country’s 24 regions most affected by HIV and AIDS to establish an integrated framework at the national level and in 59 regions of the Russian Federation that mobilizes the potential of the Russian health care system and nongovernmental organizations in the delivery of HIV and AIDS treatment, care and support. The program focuses on serving the needs of poor and marginalized populations in the Russian Federation, with special focus on injecting drug users, sex workers, men who have sex with men, prisoners and orphans.

contact-info.organisation: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

iati-activity.reporting-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
iati-activity.title: Promoting a Strategic Response to TB Treatment and Care for Vulnerable Populations in the Russian Federation
iati-activity.description: The Russian Federation experienced a dramatic increase in TB towards the end of the last century and although incidence rates have begun to level off, they remain high. The program supported by this grant is scaling up TB services in line with the Russian National TB Control Program’s strategic plans. Grant funds are being used for laboratory renovations, supplies and scaling up the smear microscopy laboratory network. The program expands DOTS-Plus for the treatment of multidrug-resistant TB and also supports the establishment of a solid basis for TB/HIV control in the country.

contact-info.organisation: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

iati-activity.participating-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

conditions.condition: PHASE2: 1. the delivery by the Principal Recipient to the Global Fund of documentation demonstrating, in form and substance satisfactory to the Global Fund, that individuals with the appropriate qualification and experience have been appointed for the following positions: a. Program Manager.

PHASE 2 CP to second disbursement: 1.the delivery by the Principal Recipient to the Global Fund, of documentation demonstrating, in form and substance satisfactory to the Global Fund, that the use of the existing monitoring and evaluation databases for HIV/AIDS-related data at the PNLS level has resumed and that accurate data collection and monitoring by the Principal Recipient is taking place.

Condition Precedent to Second Disbursement:
a. The Principal Recipient shall provide to the Global Fund, in form and substance satisfactory to the Global Fund, a revised National M&E plan, including a clear M&E framework with indicators, targets, data sources and frequency of data collection. The revised National M&E plan shall also include an overall M&E budget, which identifies funding sources and resources gaps b. The Principal Recipient shall provide to the Global Fund, in form and substance satisfactory to the Global Fund, an M&E action plan, detailing M&E activities and M&E system strengthening measures, as identified during M&E Systems Assessment (June 2008). This action plan shall include, among other things, clear timelines, lists of funding sources and responsible agencies.

iati-activity.reporting-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
iati-activity.title: Scaling up access to HIV prevention and treatment by strengthening HIV services for injecting drug users in the Russian Federation
iati-activity.description: Initially the Russian Federation’s HIV epidemic was almost exclusively spread through drug use and the sharing of contaminated needles, but heterosexual transmission is growing. The program supported by this grant aims to address the serious HIV epidemic unfolding in the Russian Federation. The program supported by this grant aims to significantly increase both the availability and the coverage of HIV prevention services for injecting drug users in 33 Russian cities. In addition to the promotion of voluntary counseling and testing, the appropriate referral of HIV-infected injecting drug users to TB treatment, training for health professionals and community members, the program is focusing strongly on the development of essential harm reduction services for injecting drug users.

contact-info.organisation: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

iati-activity.participating-org: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

2) Prepare a transition plan after the end of the contract with the Fiduciary Agency at the end of 2012.

1) Strict implementation of the written procedures regarding asset management and tracking mechanism
2) Submission of a comprehensive inventory after one year of programme execution
3) Subscription to insurance contracts for offices and equipment

1) Review the coordination mechanism between DEM and DLSI for the follow-up of rehabilitations
2) PR should share proposal and ToR for contracting an external architect to monitor the works and ensure the cost is covered in the budget
